member.name: P:WinCopies.IPCService.Client.ClientOptions.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: The number of milliseconds to wait for the server to respond before the connection times out. Default value is 60000.

member.name: P:WinCopies.IPCService.Client.ClientOptions.UseSimpleTypeNameAssemblyFormatHandling
member.summary:
Indicates the method that will be used during deserialization on the server for locating and loading assemblies. If false, the assembly used during deserialization must match exactly the assembly used during serialization.
If true, the assembly used during deserialization need not match exactly the assembly used during serialization. Specifically, the version numbers need not match.
Default is false.

member.name: T:WinCopies.IPCService.Client.Properties.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:WinCopies.IPCService.Client.Properties.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:WinCopies.IPCService.Client.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:WinCopies.IPCService.Client.Properties.Resources.OnlySupport
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Only support {0}, ex: x => x.GetData(a, b).

member.name: P:WinCopies.IPCService.Client.Properties.Resources.UnableToConvertReturnedValue
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Unable to convert returned value to '{0}'..

member.name: T:WinCopies.IPCService.Client.StreamWrapper
member.summary: Tcp clients depend on both a TcpClient object and a Stream object. This wrapper class ensures they are simultaneously disposed of.

member.name: M:WinCopies.IPCService.Client.StreamWrapper.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,WinCopies.IDisposable)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The IDisposable context the Stream depends on.
